Re ''Men Searching for Road Map on Ever-Evolving Role of Fathers,'' by Matthew Purdy (Our Towns column, June 18):

As a divorced father living apart from my two teenage children, I was reminded of how Father's Day is always a bittersweet occasion. I suspect that many fathers in my situation experience this day with a mixture of emotions.

For me, I realize that I've never gotten used to the constant worry and sadness I feel when I think about my daughter and son. Father's Day seems to bring these feelings into sharper focus. Mr. Purdy says fathers ''are still hunters, searching for their perfect role.''
For divorced fathers, it's a much more difficult and painful search, but well worth the persistence required. WILL DUCHON West Harrison, N.Y., June 18, 2000
